text: is the capital city of Ehime Prefecture in Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Matsuyama" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 620. Matsuyama is on the northwest coast of Shikoku. It has been recognized as a core city since 2000.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research, Vol. 2011 (2011), p. 8 [PDF 8 of 14]; retrieved 2012-12-5. ==History== ===Timeline=== * 1603 (Keichō 8): Kato Yoshiakira built Matsuyama Castle * 1854 (Ansei 1 ): Matsuyama Castle destroyed by fire * 1889 (Meiji 22): Modern city is incorporated The city is known for hot springs (onsen). Dōgo Onsen in Matsuyama is the oldest hot spring bath house in Japan. Eight of the eighty-eight temples in the Shikoku Pilgrimage are in Matsuyama. ==Related pages == * Ehime F.C. == References == ==Other websites== * http://www.city.matsuyama.ehime.jp/lang/en/ ; Category:Cities in Ehime Prefecture
